channel.title: Leaflet on GBIF Data Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Leaflet on GBIF Data Blog

item.title: Plot almost anything using the GBIF maps API
item.description: The GBIF maps API is an under-used but powerful web service provided by GBIF. The maps API is used by the main GBIF portal to create the maps including the big map used on gbif.org. We can make a simple call to the API by pasting the link below into a web browser. https://api.gbif.org/v2/map/occurrence/density/0/0/0@1x.png?style=purpleYellow.point You should end up with an image like this. This api call is composed essentially of two elements

item.title: GBIF data quality issues and flags what do they mean?
item.description: Flags Not all data that GBIF recieves is perfect or “fit-for-use” if you want to be politically correct. Data Quality flags are probably an under-used GBIF feature as some flags are not easy to understand. In this post I will demystify some of the data quality flags at GBIF. Coordinates Rounded This flag gets the top spot because the names has two reasonable interpretations.
